course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Chinese Buddhism
course.description: This course provides a critical survey of the basic problems and ideas of various schools of Chinese Buddhism based on an analytical study of their writings. It includes an exposition of the characteristics of Chinese Buddhism through a comparative study with Indian Buddhism.

reviews.author: Laricto
reviews.comment_content:
This course aims at a survey of the fundamental issues in Chinese Buddhism. Through the selection and discussion of some important texts of significant schools of Chinese Buddhism, namely, the Three Treatise school, the Consciousness-only school, the T`ien-tai school, the Hua-yen school, the Ch`an school, and some philosophical debates in the modern period, students are expected to familiarize themselves with the main doctrines and arguments of the Chinese Buddhist philosophy. It is also expected that a comprehensive understanding of the selected materials will provide a solid foundation for students to have further research on the subjects concerned.
